alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Jacksonboro and Adams Run northeast through West Ashley and North Charleston. As much as a inch of rain has already fallen in a few spot and as additional heavy rain falls, there will be a risk of minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Johns Island, West Ashley, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Ladson, Downtown Charleston, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Hollywood, Ravenel, Seabrook Island, Meggett, Rockville, Delemar Crossroads, Yonges Island, Wadmalaw Island, Adams Run and Bears Bluff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
